sentence.Network_en: My only point is that it has been a Pyrrhic victory.
sentence.Network_cn: 我惟一的想法是,他们为此付出了惨重的代价,未免得不偿失.

sentence.Network_en: I know , just because it was a Pyrrhic victory for them.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次胜利对他们而言实在是得不偿失.

sentence.Network_en: Sadly, it was a pyrrhic victory.
sentence.Network_cn: 不过, 这次胜利代价不斐.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from the name Pyrrhus + -ic
early 17th cent.: via Latin from Greek purrhikhios (pous) 'pyrrhic (foot'), the metre of a song accompanying a war dance, named after Purrhikhos, inventor of the dance

means.word_mean: 1. a metrical unit with unstressed-unstressed syllables
2. an ancient Greek dance imitating the motions of warfare
1. of or relating to a war dance of ancient Greece;
2. of or relating to or containing a metrical foot of two unstressed syllables;
3. of or relating to or resembling Pyrrhus or his exploits (especially his sustaining staggering losses in order to defeat the Romans);

auth_sentence.content: Victory's victory becomes Pyrrhic, the tragedy embittering the triumph.
auth_sentence.res_content: Victory's victory becomes Pyrrhic, the tragedy embittering the triumph.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Victory's victory becomes Pyrrhic, the tragedy embittering the triumph.

auth_sentence.content: The question is whether what they have accomplished is a pyrrhic victory.
auth_sentence.res_content: The question is whether what they have accomplished is a pyrrhic victory.
